extendedIngredients.name: beef top sirloin steak
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 beef top sirloin steak (1 inch thick and 1-1/4 pounds)

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small red onion, halved and thinly sliced

recipes.title: Chili-Rubbed Steak & Bread Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Steak. After all, beef and red wine are a classic combination. Generally, leaner steaks go well with light or medium-bodied reds, such as pinot noir or merlot, while fattier steaks can handle a bold red, such as cabernet sauvingnon. The Taltarni Three Monks Cabernet Merlot with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Taltarni Three Monks Cabernet Merlot
productMatches.description: Taltarni Three Monks is a Cabernet-Merlot blend that combines two very compatible grape varieties sourced from Victoria. It is set to complement Taltarni's reputation for remarkable Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon.The medium-bodied palate is soft, smooth and fills the mouth with ripe berry flavours which are complimented with subtle oak and vanilla. The finish is fresh and clean.Designed for perfect enjoyment on release, it will also reward cellaring. It is an ideal choice matched with lamb veal or your favourite à la Carte meal, such as beef Carpaccio.Blend: 52% cabernet, 48% merlot

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Mix chili powder, brown sugar, salt and pepper; rub over steak. Let stand 15 minutes.                                                                                           Meanwhile, toss bread cubes with oil. In a large skillet, toast bread over medium heat 8-10 minutes or until crisp and lightly browned, stirring frequently. In a small bowl, whisk salad dressing, horseradish and mustard.                                                                                           Grill steak, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from heat 6-8 minutes on each side or until meat reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare, a thermometer should read 145°; medium, 160°; well-done, 170°). Let stand 5 minutes.                                                                                           In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion and toasted bread. Add 1/2 cup dressing mixture; toss to coat. Slice steak; serve with salad and remaining dressing.                                        Yield: 6 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Chili-Rubbed Steak & Bread Salad in  Taste of Home                                                                                                                                                                                                Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving equals 434 calories, 30 g fat (6 g saturated fat), 45 mg cholesterol, 682 mg sodium, 18 g carbohydrate, 3 g fiber, 23 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Mix chili powder, brown sugar, salt and pepper; rub over steak.

Meanwhile, toss bread cubes with oil. In a large skillet, toast bread over medium heat 8-10 minutes or until crisp and lightly browned, stirring frequently. In a small bowl, whisk salad dressing, horseradish and mustard.

Grill steak, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from heat 6-8 minutes on each side or until meat reaches desired doneness (for medium-rare, a thermometer should read 145°; medium, 160°; well-done, 170°).
In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion and toasted bread.
Add 1/2 cup dressing mixture; toss to coat. Slice steak; serve with salad and remaining dressing.
